title: St. Ambrose
marks: Signature and Date ML (incised with fine pointed instrument on spine
text: One of the Four Fathers of the Catholic Church, Saint Ambrose (334'-397 A.D.) was Bishop of Milan, once the administrative center of the western part of the Roman Empire.  He is shown with a knotted scourge to signify that he drove the Arian heretics from the Church.  This is generally considered the most important painting by this artist in North America.
description: Saint Ambrose Father of the Catholic Church
